column2: I enjoy working on more than one project a time.

column27: What do you think/hope time management can help you to do?
column28: Please tell us (as many as possible) the advices/methods/tools you find useful to you in your time management?
column29: Please tell us (as many as possible) the advices/methods/tools you find useless to you in your time management?

column27: Do my task in regular and in order. maintain it.
column28: 1. Think about duration of that task(how much it takes). 2.think about what it needs to be done for that task. 3. think about how much time I have. 3. make a section from that task. 4. put section in my daily plan. 5. define the start point and finish point for that. 5. write it down on paper. 6.track it.
column29: use google app to remind me my tasks. use reminder of mac to define tasks and other stuff.
taking alot of time in thinking for small things

column27: Stay focussed, don't get distracted, have better feeling for time
column28: Ivy Lee Methode, have a clean environment, divide big tasks into subtasks, do sports for general health/mental focus

column27: Prioritising, keeping focus, taking enough breaks
column28: To do lists, JIRA, calendar (block off time for specific tasks), forcing myself to take breaks when I get stuck
column29: Rigid time management frameworks, especially when the focus/work intervals are too short

column28:
Calendar and task-function in Outlook
Calendar on mobile phone

column27: To reduce working hours and / or being more efficient

column28: Split tasks in smaller portion working on them one after another

column27: Work more efficiently and get things done on time
column29:
Impossible deadlines
Working when tired or ill

column27: Manage my time and my energy better
column28: Breaking down tasks into small actionable units. Calendars. Pomodoro. Turning off phone and all other distractions.
column29: Getting too much advice instead of actually doing the work
Anything involving technology! Sorry. I prefer to write things down

column27: Help me manage tasks more effectively and efficiently.
column28: I use timers on my phone. I write lists mostly on my phone or on paper.
column29: I find anything too involved doesn’t help. Can’t use a complicated app for instance because the stress of it makes things worse. I prefer tactile things or simple interfaces. Anything that nudges me or sends lots of messages actually gets in the way.
